Sarasota.Payne Park: Payne Park was a baseball field that stood from 1924 to 1990, and is now an public park in the same location which replaced it, in Sarasota, Florida. Payne Park, the original stadium for the city of Sarasota, was built on a portion of 60 acres (240,000 m2) of land donated by Calvin Payne and his wife, Martha. Payne Park today is a 29-acre (120,000 m2) public park used for recreational and high school sporting events.
